3.2. Island Gestion¶

3.2.1. pystepx.island.pystepislands – pySTEP islands enable module¶

PySTEP version working with an island mode. Several population evolve on different islands. After each generation, some individuals can migrate in other islands.

The api is the same than PySTEPX.

AUTHOR Romain Giot <romain.giot@ensicaen.fr>
class pystepx.island.pystepislands.MigrationOperator¶

Migration operator managing how the population migrates between islands.

We suppose that islands are placed in a circle way. Migration is done in the island before and after. In this implementation, population migrates in an aleatory way in another island

manage_migration()¶

Launch the migration process with:

  • selecting the individuals to migrate
  • moving these individuals in their new island
replace_individuals()¶
For each island, put its migrant in another island.
select_and_remove_individuals()¶
For each island, select the individuals to migrate and remove them from the island.
set_migration_probability(prob)¶

Set the migration probability.

Parameter:prob (float) – probability of migration in each direction
set_nb_islands(value)¶

Set the number of islands involved in the process.

Parameter:value (integer) – number of islands involved
class pystepx.island.pystepislands.PySTEPXIsland(nb_islands=3, init_script='', db_path='/tmp/pySTEPX%d.sqlite')¶

Manage the island model. the API is the same than PySTEPX. On evolver is built for each island.

XXX allows an asynchronous process (no wait for ended generation, lost possibility during migration) XXX pull and push to the required servers (not all)

evolve()¶

Launch the evoluation process. Each evolver operates in its own island.

Returns:The best individual
set_migration_operator(operator)¶

Set the operator manaing the migration.

Parameter:operator – instance of the migration operator to use

3.2.2. pystepx.island.evolver – Island specialized evolver¶

Specialized evolver in the case of distributed GP

class pystepx.island.evolver.DistributedEvolver(popsize=200, root_node=(0, 1, 'root'), min_depth=2, max_depth=8, buildmethod='AddHalfNode', max_nb_runs=100, fitness_criterion=9.9999999999999995e-08, crossover_prob=0.5, mutation_prob=0.48999999999999999, size=7, prob_selection=0.80000000000000004)¶

Distributed evolver. This evolver is able to add and suppress individuals from its population. This allows the possibility of migration.

Run¶

XXX Use the sequantial version

The highest level function of the package. It starts an evolutionary run with given parameters,and gives indications of what is found after each generation.

Parameter:verbose – print the best tree of each generation
SetSubstituteMutation¶
Set if we must substitute mutation
TournamentSelectionEvolveDBPopulation2¶
create a new population of randomly generated trees and write this new generation to a new table of name ‘tab’+generation number in the database.
Parameters:
  • popsize – size of the population
  • maxdepth – max depth of trees in new generation
  • crossover_prob – probability of crossover (will determine what proportion of the population will be replaced by crossover-generated offsprings) :param mutation_prob: probability of crossover (will determine what proportion of the population will be replaced by mutation-generated offsprings) :param con: Connection to database param tablename: name of the database table of the initial population :param tablename2: name of the database table of the next generation
add_new_trees(trees)¶

Import new individual from other islands. Do not compute again their threshold.

Parameter:trees – set of trees to import
get_best_individual¶
Returns information about the best individual.
get_real_popsize¶
Returns the real popsize
get_tree¶
Return the required tree. :TODO: move this in the right class
is_evolution_ended¶
Look if the evolution is ended, because:
  • the maximum generation is get
  • the fitness is set
load_tree¶
Load the information of the tree
print_end_generation¶
Print if necessary information about the best tree of the generation.
run_sequentially(verbose=True, print_tree=True)¶
Run the evolution and stops yield each generation. The process never ends
select_and_remove_individuals(prob)¶

Select several individuals from the population, remove them from the island and returns them.

Parameter:prob – probability of selection of individuals for migration
